schema.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

schema.name: ID

schema.name: requestBody

name: CustomerAccounts-InvoicePDFs-GET-getInvoicePDFs
description: [Customer Accounts] GET /invoicePDFs/{ID} — Retrieves a single customer invoice PDF instance.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

name: CustomerAccounts-Invoices-GET-getInvoices_1
description: [Customer Accounts] GET /invoices — Retrieves a collection of customer invoices and adjustments.

schema.name: billToCustomer
schema.description: The customer on the invoice.

schema.name: company
schema.description: query parameter: company

schema.name: fromDueDate
schema.description: The due date of the customer invoice or invoice adjustment as of the defined reporting date, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

schema.name: fromInvoiceDate
schema.description: The date of the customer invoice, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

schema.name: invoiceStatus
schema.description:
The current status of an invoice document.

Include invoices with these invoice statuses:
Approved (91b0d382d50848e898733757caa9f84a), 
Canceled (dc76c9b6446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Denied (dc76c7cc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Draft (dc76c4fc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Incomplete(e264bc68581342baa70ab61bf71032fe), 
In Progress (dc76c8bc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6).

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: paymentStatus
schema.description:
The payment status of an invoice document. 

Include invoices with these payments statuses:
Paid (d9e4362a446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Unpaid (d9e43940446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Partially Paid (d9e43706446c11de98360015c5e6daf6).

schema.name: toDueDate
schema.description: The due date of the customer invoice or invoice adjustment as of the defined reporting date, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

schema.name: toInvoiceDate
schema.description: The date of the customer invoice, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

schema.name: transactionType
schema.description: The transaction type of this customer transaction. Use the string "invoice" or "adjustment" to filter to retrieve either only invoices or adjustments.

name: CustomerAccounts-Invoices-GET-getPrintRuns_1
description: [Customer Accounts] GET /invoices/{ID}/printRuns — Retrieves a collection of customer invoice print runs for the specified customer invoice or adjustment.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

name: CustomerAccounts-Customers-GET-getCustomers_1

schema.name: limit

schema.name: name
schema.description: query parameter: name

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.
